statement.p: Riley is conducting market research on the cost of a cell phone data plan. Riley has determined that the average annual cost of a cell phone data plan is 1010, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 86.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected consumer spends more than 943 on a cell phone data plan.
b. The cost of the middle 80 of cell phone data plans falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. The most expensive 8 of cell phone data plans cost at least how much annually?

solution.p: Define the normal distribution in Desmos: \displaystyle{N}=\text{normaldist}{\left({1010},{86}\right)}.

b. For the middle 80 of the data, need the remaining 20 of the data split between the left and right tails of the distribution. So the lower bound of the range has \displaystyle{0.1} of the area to the left and the upper bound of the range has \displaystyle{0.1} of the area to the right, which means \displaystyle{0.9} to the left.
